name: Hermes
description:
Hermes is a simple JS/HTML/CSS Google Chrome extension helping Wild Code School students to get their exercises validated.

Once they finish an exercice, students must copy/paste, on Slack, the URL of their solution in order to get it validated by peers.

I quickly realised how heavy and long this process was. Then I had the idea to create an extension in order to make it easier. The extension allows to copy all solutions URL waiting for approval and to paste them on slack with their meta-data in only one click.

The Wild Code School built his teachning platform around the greek mythology. A lesson is a quest and a cursus is an Odyssey. That's why I decided to call this tool 'Hermes', the messenger of gods.

Today, I have users from different campuses in Europe and I'm going to create other gods than Hermes offering new features.

name: Lazy Postcard
description:
Lazy Postcard is a project with which I won a Hackathon. The Hackathon thematic was how can you travel from couch during lockdown?

With my team, we decided to offer a system to keep sending postcards from all over the world in order to make your friends and colleagues jaelous...but...staying at home.

Our system connects to windy API allowing to take pictures from a global webcam meteo network. We locate webcams on Google Map allowing the user to choose it's destination and to explore available webcams in the area.

Firstly choose your cam, then take a picture of the landscape and a selfie using your own webcam. Type a friendly message and send a postcard to your friends through Facebook or Instagram.

name: Airtable Manager
description:
Airtable manager is a web-app using the Django Admin system in order to administrate the client's airtable bases from a single page.

Since the official Airtable API doesn't allow to recover metadata, the system is using a little hack, Mozilla Marionette, in order to parse Airtable API page and to recover metadata by intercepting airtable front requests.

Then, with the client's API key and previously recovered metadata, the system as a full access to the client's bases from the admin page and can automate data creation/duplication/update/deletion through backend jobs parameterized by the user (zapier's like).
